description:
Magnaporthiopsis poae ATCC 64411 is a fungal species that belongs to the phylum Ascomycota, class Sordariomycetes, and order Magnaporthales. It is a plant pathogen that primarily infects grasses, particularly the species Poa (bluegrass).

The fungus produces dark-colored, septate hyphae and forms ascomata (fruiting bodies) that release ascospores, which are the primary means of dispersal and infection. The ascospores can germinate on the host plant and penetrate the plant tissues, causing disease symptoms such as leaf spots, crown rot, and root rot.

Magnaporthiopsis poae ATCC 64411 is an important agricultural pathogen that can have significant impacts on the production of turf grasses and other forage crops. Understanding the biology and ecology of this fungus is crucial for developing effective management strategies to control the disease it causes.
